conclusion: The wires are of equal length and resistance, so the equilateral-triangle sides AC, CB and the base AB each carry the same current I.
Each straight side in a uniform, perpendicular magnetic field B experiences an Ampere (Lorentz) force F = I L B whose direction is given by the right-hand rule.

premise: The force on side AB is stated to be F (magnitude).
conclusion: The force on AB is F.

conclusion: The forces on AC and CB have the same magnitude F and are symmetrically oriented 60째 above AB.

premise: Adding the three vector forces (F on AB horizontally, and two forces of the same magnitude F making 60째 with it) gives complete cancellation: the horizontal components cancel pair-wise and the vertical components cancel as well.
conclusion: Resultant Ampere force on the whole triangular frame: 0
